name: Reinman v1.1 - Atman in Anarch
description:
I've never played an Atman deck, and I wanted to give it a try. Rather than do the normal Shaper version, I thought I'd give an Anarch version a try, given that that's where most of the support comes from, and it's my preferred faction. So far, it's going rather well. I'm able to put on a lot of early pressure thanks to the versatile breaker suite, and the potential for a lot of ICE destruction.

Notes on cards:

-Logos solves a lot of Anarch's consistency problems, to the point where I increased it from 2x. It might be overkill, but those tutors are great.

-Masanori is an untested addition in this version. I wanted card draw, so I'm giving him a whirl. He replaced 2x Bishop, which were there to keep higher ICE in Atman range. They may still be worth it, but I'm not convinced based on the decks I tried it against.

-Keyhole is amazing.

-Mimic for Swordsman.

-Djinn solves MU problems, mostly. Also tutors the 1x viruses.

Potential changes:

-Someone suggested 2x Atman and 1x Test Run. I'm considering giving it a whirl.

-The third Logos could be dropped, either for a Scavenge or 2x Quality Time. Scav is great with Atman, and QT addresses the lack of draw.

-Seriously, card draw. Anarch. Ugh.

I'm really liking where this deck is going, so any suggestions are greatly appreciated.

name: J:RP Glacier, Vagabond 2014-05-18
description: This is the corp deck I ran at the Vagabond store champs in Auckland. This deck went 4-0 on the day.

name: Magnum CT, Vagabond 2014-05-18
Tenin Remoteless v2
description:
Undefeated so far in OCTGN out of 10 fights. Changed agenda suite to 11 agenda suite and removed 1 sensei..

Basically, the game plan is: 1.) Ice HQ and RND. 2.) Throw shocks in Archives 3.) Advance those Icewalls using Tenin (this becomes taxing to run at, even had a 12 str Ice Wall) 4.) Money up!! Reclaim those celebrity gifts if you need them. 5.) Plant that Caprice and make them cry. 6.) Fast advance using trick of light. Reclaim and repeat.

A 4 ice server usually costs around 10 plus credits. Sensei is Star here. If you are agenda flooded, JH is there to rescue you.

name: Punitive Red Coats
description:
Modified a Red Coats deck to punish the runner when they manage to hit a 3-point agenda.

I don't know how to do the "derived from" but clearly this is derived from a standard Red Coats deck.

name: Vampire
description: Vamp the corp down to 0 credits and then brutalize R&D.

name: Punitive Medicine
description: The ID means I only need to score 2 Agendas. If I land a Shi-Kyu, they need 3. That gives me two opportunities to Punitive them.

name: Bullet to the Face
description: I am new at this but I built this with the idea of tagging the runner and flatlining him primarily with meat damage. I have messed with it and tampered but it still isnt perfect. Moderately successful but. Am also new so as i get better, so does this deck. Any advice would be wonderful

name: The Shape of Anarchy
description:
This is a deck designed to get pressure right off the get go while also building up a rig that will be devastating later.

The CyberSolutions Mem Chips are the absolute core of this deck, the number you have out determines the suite of programs you have to keep the pressure on the corp. This deck is an MU hog and it can afford to be based on how many of these you have in play.

Getting a Yog on a Dinosaurus is not a requirement for the deck, that's an end game play that can be placed on personal workshops while you have a normal Yog in play and keep pressure up.

Magnum Opus is the key economic driver but it doesn't carry the load on it's own. Modded allows you to get something into play right now quickly and as a surprise while Personal Workshop is designed to let you avoid paying for things you don't need yet. Stick something on on the workshop after drawing it with Quality Time and continue pressuring the corp.

However unlike most Magnum Opus based decks, this one can last for a little while waiting on drawing it naturally, Sahasrara, Personal Workshop and Modded can safely work the beginning of the game if you end up with them and no MO

This deck originally ran 1 each of the full anarch suite of breakers but got Yog.0 out slow and with datasucker counters Inti usually works beautifully so 2 extra Yog's replaced a corroder.

Gordian Blade and Paintbrush will get you in anywhere with enough credits in case you get locked out of centrals to get your datasucker counters.

Paintbrush is a late game card when you've got all of your MU out that let's you Yog through just about anything with a Yogasaurus and Datasuckers counters if needed.

If you end up with no money troubles and waiting on your CyberSolutions, try putting a single replicator in as kind of a hail mary play. If you get it out before your Cybersolutions you are really rolling from that point on.

Escher would be a great card to find room for a 1 of in this deck.

name: Texting while Diving (VoicePAD Rush)
description:
Since "Express" is his middle name...

The goal of this deck is to run early, often, and usually by playing an Event. Prepaid VoicePAD and Desperado, and your very own identity finance this endeavor. Sure Gamble and Lucky Find get even better when you can use recurring credits to pay for them. Quality Time makes sure you don't run out of Events any time soon, and digging deep with Maker's Eye and Legwork should help you find those juicy Agendas.

The central breaker suite applies pressure, with Faerie helping with face-checking without dying. If the Corp finally builds a remote with two ICE, Knight and Crypsis will get you through.

It's not a complicated deck, but it's definitely a rush.

name: The Key to Victory
description: Made for a Honour & Profit Tournament, where only the H&P identities are legal, so I know I'll be playing against Jinteki only. Keyhole and Femme everything on R&D, possibly by discarding femmes and retrieval run them in again.

name: The Key to Victory
description: Made for a Honour & Profit Tournament, where only the H&P identities are legal, so I know I'll be playing against Jinteki only. Keyhole and Femme everything on R&D, possibly by discarding femmes and retrieval run them in again.

name: Andromeda test facile facile(cit)
description:
Chi coglie la citazione di un utente del gruppo fb merita un biscottino!

Secondo me si sente la mancanza di planned assault ma non so cosa levare

i compromised employee sono gran carte,prima di suggerire di levarle pensateci, per favore!

Passo e chiudo, lascio la parola allo studio!

name: The Key to Victory
description: Made for a Honour & Profit Tournament, where only the H&P identities are legal, so I know I'll be playing against Jinteki only. Keyhole and Femme everything on R&D, possibly by discarding femmes and retrieval run them in again.

name: Black and Redguard 1.1
description: Same as the old see (http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/5043/black-and-redguard) with reduced size (back to 45) and some minor changes in card quantity. Also got 2 Bishops and an Ice Carver for plan B traditional breaking. Regards to Heartthrob for his Blackguard of the Red Queen (http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/2769/blackguard-of-the-red-queen-version-2-0) this deck is heavily based on.

name: Trick Of Light Advance 1.1
description: This deck underwent some serious changes and overall second tactic. I managed to make some space for a Shipment from Sansan + Efficiency Committee combo to gain some better "fast advancability" in combination with the previous Trick of Light combo. Old deck (http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/5047/trick-of-light-advance).

name: Killing Your Software
description: For a Honour & Profit night, where only the three new criminal identities are legal. I hope to hit them at their weak spot, no program recursion.

name: Exile Combo Power 1.0
description:
The General premise is to combo ICE breakers into play using Stimhack & SMC or Testrun Scavenge.

The Djinn is in to provide a place for Opus, SMC and virus's to sit and look for the Nerve Agent / Medium for runs.

Modded is in to help get the bigger breakers down if u get them in hand / for virus & Opus.

Comments Welcome

name: Ken Bot 3rd place Huddersfield regional
description: Deck I used at the Huddersfield regional. A few people were interested so I thought I'd post it

name: Oracle Rielle - v2
description:
Here's version two of my Maytivation combo with Kit. One of the main problems that I found with version one was that I couldn't apply early pressure if I didn't get test run/scavenge for torch. My answer to that was cyber cyphers, and it's actually worked pretty well. The only problem is that if I do manage to get torch out early, the cycys become dead draws. Maybe I need SMC for more targeted selection of my tools? Another change that I made was including Levy, I've found that heavy net damage decks can really mess me up.

Overall changes include

-1 Makers Eye

-2 The Personal Touch

+2 Cyber Cipher

+1 Levy AR Lab Access

I suppose that pulling out the personal touch worries me, with the fixed breakers and whatnot. I suppose that's what femme is for...

Version one seen in the "derived from" section.

name: Oracle Mayfly
description:
Derived from x3r0h0ur's "Faerush Paintbrush Rush", except I've scrapped ProCons for Oracle May / Motivation. I've also fudged with the quantities of certain cards and put Diesels in, because I just love Diesel-ing through a 40-card deck way too much.

The idea here is draw like a maniac until you get your Oracle May combo down, at which point you click that once a turn and spend the rest of the turn rushing/painting/Indexing/causing anarchy.

I like the idea of this better than the idea of the ProCons-based economy just because that 5 credit install cost hurts so much, and because clicking Oracle May once a turn squeezes more money out of the deck.

name: NEXT Bioroid Offensive
Caïssa Denial
description:
Reina Roja economy denial deck, with Caïssa to taste. Reina, Rook, and Xanadu are for preventing ice from being rezzed; Knight and the other breakers are for when plan A fails. Shutdowns to induce hear-tearing, Pawn and Deja Vu for program recovery.

I considered the strength-reduction suite with Bishop. Datasucker, Ice Carver, and some combination of Yog.0, Darwin, and Mimic, but it was frankly a lot of cards that don't necessarily play well with Knight.

name: H&P Andromeda
description:
It's been since about creation and control since I've played Andromeda with any consistency, so I thought I'd circle around back to her. With big taxing ice decks being a thing, and good resource econ available, I wanted to cash in on that.

This produces a metric fuckton of money, and ensures you'll get in where you want. I dropped out all denial except siphon in favor of being able to threaten remotes with big dollars and efficient breakers, so that I can get agendas to pile up in HQ for some fancy legwork.

I'm sure I'll miss e-shutdown from time to time but playing the same cards all the time is boring. Ignore siphon at this juncture.

In playing it I've had 30-40 credits because there is so much econ, and it feels pretty great. It stands up to asset trashing fairly well, and lets you do some rig building which is always kinda great.

I might swap out tri-maf for same old thing to keep the pressure up, but it really helps mid-game with econ spiking.

name: NEXT Bioroid Offense
Eeny, medium, miny, moe
description:
This deck is a bomb. Dont run R&D, and when the Corp does something like San San+score you can Vamp the opponent to 0,grab lots of money then run Medium runs. Ran in in a 14 man tournament today; had a couple of great games, and a couple of close losses. This deck struggles for consistancy a lot; no kati, or missing another key piece really halts it down.

Fun thing is, that playing Medium makes people ICE up R&D more, when your Vamp targets HQ. The mystery star in this deck is Inside Job. Tried the deck with Account Syphon, but that isn't even half as good.

Anyways, great deck to play. Fun to catch people offguard with. Didnt get flatlined a single time, as I have lots of money, or the opponent is broke.

name: Cool Runnings
description: hq lock mon

name: Hissatsu
description: chou damage, very deathblow, wow

name: Retired Motivational Speaker (Petrie's Colorado Regional 2nd
description:
How did this get a second place finish? Haha, what?!

My game plan going into the tournament was to sit back, play 3x Underworld Contact while delaying game with The Source + Fall Guy and earn 5c/turn towards Keyhole runs.

The plan went swimmingly until I hit FA decks going so fast I felt whiplash. Unfortunately, against FA decks, I had to abandon plans for free money and play as aggressively as possible with Siphon, HQI, and central harassment. Motivation + Oracle May kept me alive for econ. (Always say "I'm feeling very motivated!" when you peek at your stack. It helps.)

Data Dealer was a one-of in anticipation of mass Shi Kyu play... of which I saw zero.

S&W was included for sniping Caprice, Ash, and Jackson Howard. If your opponent doesn't realize it, you can snipe JH after the HQ run if they don't immediately declare the trash post-run. Only works the first time before they figure it out, heh. Saw zero Caprice and Ash all day.

Shout out to Crash Space- free tag removal and soft Scorch protection is arguably better than Plascrete. I will likely be playing Crash Space over Plascrete in Criminal for awhile.

Toughest matchups were against Jason's HB full of meaty ICE and FA tricks, and the Team Covenant lads' NBN decks. Against those decks, I wished I was playing a more typical Criminal.

Jackson makes this deck cry, just like conventional Noise milling. Hard to snipe all the Jacksons before going all-in with Keyhole mills.

I think there is promise in this deck type, but I'm not sure that I will pursue developing it.

Dropped 2 games in Swiss and it cost me the tournament in the finals against Steven Wooley.

name: Stormy Weather (Petrie's Colorado Regional 2nd Place)
description:
Named after the deck's pièce de résistance, Susanoo-No-Mikoto (or as I like to call it, Little Suzie Mikoto). This deck will spread your opponent thin and have them scrambling to deal with threats.

This deck went 5-2 (once in swiss, and first round of elim) and really carried me through the Losers Bracket of the top 8 elimination series.

Inazuma + Susanoo + Ash/Caprice provided an incomparable 5/3 scoring remote. Adding Grim, Archer, and/or Shocks to Archives is terribly fun as well.

Inazuma and Future Perfect... those are some good cards, y'all.

Thanks to Kyle and Matt for the recommendations on Guard and Rainbow.

Most people were surprised to see Medical Research Fundraiser, but it gets Jinteki back in the game after scoring an agenda. This is a deck in which I didn't want to reveal my hand. The boon to the runner is quickly lost to the taxing ICE here.

Over the course of the day, I must have won the Psi game ~60% of the time. Clutch Psi game win to stay alive in the Losers Bracket, too!

Multiple game wins advancing a 5/3 once at 4 points. For some reason, most of my opponents didn't consider A, A, Trick of Light for the game win.

name: Newdromeda
description:
2014.05.18 - Rotterdam (Season 1 tournament) - first place

It's a pretty standard Andromeda deck. I have tried out plenty of cards from the new Honor and Profit expansion, but I wasn't impressed with most of them. I decided to only include Legwork and Planned Assault, because they were the ones with the most utility.

Since I was expecting a lot of Jinteki decks, Deus X is there to deal with their nasty surprises (Shi.Kyū, Komainu, Snare, etc.). If needed, I can tutor for it with the Special Orders. I also made sure that I have at least of two of every breaker subtype, so no unexpected damage ruins my abilities. I also included an e3 Feedback Implants against HB decks and the ever-present Eli 1.0-s.

name: Purple Void
description:
I feel like Mushin No Shin has a lot of potential outside of Jinteki, despite the cost in influence. This deck tries to win by using Mushin No Shin on an Haas Arcology AI, and use it to Fast-Ad agendas. It has a strong economy, lots of end-the-run type of ICE and a few fun interactions (Efficiency Commity and Shipment from mirrormorph are both nice with Mushin No shin, Inazuma is over all great with Bioroid ICE, etc.).

Not exhaustively tested yet. Any comment appreciated!

name: NBN - Meh
description:
2014.05.18 - Rotterdam (Season 1 tournament) - first place

The main goal is to score an AstroScript Pilot Program with preferably a Biotic Labor to get the astro-train going. Fast Track helps a lot. SanSan City Grid is also an option, but multiple usage usually requires a strong remote or a broke runner. It is also good for just creating an unguarded remote. If you have enough money, the runner will be forced to trash it unrezzed, pushing him towards poverty. It's super fun to taunt them with NAPD Contacts while they are poor. The single Bernice Mai is there to waste the runner's clicks and credits, plus the scared runner might consider wasting resources on a Plascrete Carapace.

Other cards are pretty standard, I guess :)

name: INDUSTRIAL-ICED
description:
Hello, this is my GRNDL Power Build called "INDUSTRIAL-ICED" :)

And my special interest is to use the Corporate Troubleshooter because i think this is an underrated card. I think it fits very good to this Strong Economy Identity. What do you think about my build ?? Please discuss. Have fun !

name: Tax Loopholes (6th place Colorado Regionals)
description:
This deck went 4-3 on the day. Lost twice in swiss and once in the elimination rematch between myself and the eventual champion. Oddly enough all 3 loses were to Reina, twice to the same opponent.

It may look like a deck trying to do too many things, but it is really a different approach to Fast Advance. Asset econ to protect from siphons and recover quickly. SanSan and Biotic to fast advance agendas. Taxing ICE that is generally affordable to rez. And a ton of recursion to bring back any pieces I need.

I made a last minute change to Private Contracts instead of Restructure and I am very glad I did. I think I got more out of Private Contracts then I ever got out of Restructure.

Be sure to check out the rematch between myself and Team Covenant's Steven Wooley when they post the videos. It was one hell of a game!

name: Chaos Chips
description:
An Overmind-centric deck, with a few useful events you can recur through SOT.

In general, you want to get as much of the hardware as possible on the table, then Overmind your way through anything that's there. Use the Siphons to slow the Corp down, use Mimic in case of Swordsman and Inti in case of Wraparound. The Feedback Implants are handy if you are low on Overmind counters and high on the money. If you have the Inside Men on the table, you should be sorted for all the money you need for the hardware. Armitages/Magnum Opus/Desperado should be enough to keep you running often.

SMC is useful for the usual mid-run installs, but also works nicely with Scavenge as a 2 MU Clone Chip ;).

If you have a slow start, Diesel through your hand to get the right pieces, then Levy AR to rebuild your deck.

Variants you can experiment with:

  • Replacing Armitage with Underworld Contacts
  • Replacing the Clone Chips with Quality Time or additional economy
  • Increasing the number of e3 Feedback Implants (you'd have to be careful with dropping any of the OOF cards included - maybe swap Desperado for Dinosaurus?)
  • Adding an Aesop's or two for additional economy before you use Levy AR

Feedback welcome!

name: ♌ Old School Stirling
description:
Old fashioned but efficient.

Mulligan for Logos or Express Delivery.

Version 1.1 : -1 Fall Guy, -1 Q-Chip, -1 Easy Mark, +2 VoicePAD, +1 Dirty Laundry

name: Shaper 1.0
description: First Go at a C & C based Deck

name: hb 1
Annoying to Perfection v2
description:
The idea is to go against the usual Jinteki approach and win by scoring agendas. Replicating Perfection makes this posible by forcing the runner to run centrals first. The decks annoys the runner by making everything so expensive that it's impossible to run every turn.

You should put your most taxing ICE on centrals, so that the runner is forced to either pay a lot or get really hurt, so you get scoring windows for your agendas. You're also trying to make the runner poor by making him pay a lot trash your resources (which he can get to only after running centrals).

Now the agendas.Since almost all of your agendas force the runner to pay for them, they need lots of money to run, because they need to pay for your ICE first, and then they need to have enough money to steal your agendas, so you use that time to score before they have enough money to run.

The net damage is just to stall the runner and hopefully get key cards from their hands, not to get a flatline. Shi kyu is ther instead of shock to protect your archives.

I think there's a lot of room for improvement, but I'm still testing the deck, so any suggestions are appreciated in the comments.

name: Please don't play Bug!  (Phoenix Regionals 2nd Place)
description:
This was the corp deck that I took to a second place finish yesterday at the Phoenix, AZ Regionals. This is actually derived from @djackman's deck, here: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/4776/nbn-na-rush-h-p-update

There were 55ish people, with 6 rounds of swiss and a cut to top 8.

Go here for the runner deck: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/5749/ser-gabriel-phoenix-regionals-2nd-place-

SWISS:

Round 1: BYE (from store champs)

Round 2: vs. Chaos Theory Siphon/Big Breakers -- Loss

Round 3: vs. Andromeda Standard -- Win

Round 4: vs. Gabe Connections (Tri-Maf, Fall Guy, The Source) -- Win

Round 5: vs. Tenma Planned Assault -- Win

Round 6: vs. Kate Parasite Recursion -- Loss

TOP 8:

Round 1: vs. Ser Gabe -- Loss

Round 4: vs. Ser Gabe -- Win (same person as Round 1)

Round 5: vs. Gabe Connections -- Win

description:
This was the corp deck that I took to a second place finish yesterday at the Phoenix, AZ Regionals.

There were 55ish people, with 6 rounds of swiss and a cut to top 8.

Go here for the corp deck: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/5748/please-don-t-play-bug-phoenix-regionals-2nd-place-

TOP 8:

Round 3: vs. HB Fast Advance -- Win (same as Round 4 of Swiss)

Round 6: vs. HB Fast Advance -- Loss (same as Round 6 of Swiss)

name: Exile Faeriebrush
